ยง 4612. Residents' organizations. 1. Continuing care retirement
contract holders shall have the right of self-organization, the right to
be represented by one or more individuals of their own choosing, and the
right to engage in concerted activities for the purpose of keeping
informed of the operation of the community in which they live.
 2. The board of directors, a designated representative, or other such
governing body of a continuing care retirement community shall meet at
least four times a year with residents' representatives and shall hold a
general meeting of all residents once a year for the purpose of
discussing subjects including, but not limited to, the financial
position of the community, the quality of social and health services at
the community, and any proposed changes in policies, programs or
services.
